text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition ext-R5-ConditionDefinition

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*ExtensionA definition of a condition
Slices for extension 2..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Closed by value:url
extension:url 0..1ExtensionCanonical identifier for this condition definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
value[x] 0..1uriCanonical identifier for this condition definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
extension:version 0..1ExtensionBusiness version of the condition definition
value[x] 0..1stringBusiness version of the condition definition
extension:versionAlgorithm[x] 0..1ExtensionHow to compare versions
value[x] 0..1How to compare versions
Binding: version-algorithm (??) (extensible)
valueStringstring
valueCodingCoding
extension:name 0..1ExtensionName for this condition definition (computer friendly)
value[x] 0..1stringName for this condition definition (computer friendly)
extension:title 0..1ExtensionName for this condition definition (human friendly)
value[x] 0..1stringName for this condition definition (human friendly)
extension:subtitle 0..1ExtensionSubordinate title of the event definition
value[x] 0..1stringSubordinate title of the event definition
extension:status ?!1..1Extensiondraft | active | retired | unknown
value[x] 0..1codedraft | active | retired | unknown
Binding: Cross-version VS for R5.PublicationStatus for use in FHIR R4 (required): The lifecycle status of an artifact.
extension:experimental 0..1ExtensionFor testing purposes, not real usage
value[x] 0..1booleanFor testing purposes, not real usage
extension:date 0..1ExtensionDate last changed
value[x] 0..1dateTimeDate last changed
extension:publisher 0..1ExtensionName of the publisher/steward (organization or individual)
value[x] 0..1stringName of the publisher/steward (organization or individual)
extension:contact 0..*ExtensionContact details for the publisher
value[x] 0..1ContactDetailContact details for the publisher
extension:description 0..1ExtensionNatural language description of the condition definition
value[x] 0..1markdownNatural language description of the condition definition
extension:useContext 0..*ExtensionThe context that the content is intended to support
value[x] 0..1UsageContextThe context that the content is intended to support
extension:jurisdiction 0..*ExtensionIntended jurisdiction for condition definition (if applicable)
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptIntended jurisdiction for condition definition (if applicable)
Binding: Jurisdiction ValueSet (extensible): Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.
extension:severity 0..1ExtensionSubjective severity of condition
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptSubjective severity of condition
Binding: Condition/DiagnosisSeverity (preferred): A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.
extension:bodySite 0..1ExtensionAnatomical location, if relevant
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptAnatomical location, if relevant
Binding: SNOMEDCTBodyStructures (example): SNOMED CT Body site concepts
extension:stage 0..1ExtensionStage/grade, usually assessed formally
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptStage/grade, usually assessed formally
Binding: ConditionStage (example): Codes describing condition stages (e.g. Cancer stages).
extension:hasSeverity 0..1ExtensionWhether Severity is appropriate
value[x] 0..1booleanWhether Severity is appropriate
extension:hasBodySite 0..1ExtensionWhether bodySite is appropriate
value[x] 0..1booleanWhether bodySite is appropriate
extension:hasStage 0..1ExtensionWhether stage is appropriate
value[x] 0..1booleanWhether stage is appropriate
extension:definition 0..*ExtensionFormal Definition for the condition
value[x] 0..1uriFormal Definition for the condition
extension:observation 0..*ExtensionObservations particularly relevant to this condition
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Closed by value:url
extension:category 0..1ExtensionCategory that is relevant
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptCategory that is relevant
Binding: ObservationCategoryCodes (preferred): Codes for high level observation categories.
extension:code 0..1ExtensionCode for relevant Observation
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptCode for relevant Observation
Binding: LOINCCodes (example): Codes identifying names of simple observations.
extension:medication 0..*ExtensionMedications particularly relevant for this condition
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Closed by value:url
extension:category 0..1ExtensionCategory that is relevant
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptCategory that is relevant
Binding: Medication request category codes (example): A coded concept identifying the category of medication request. For example, where the medication is to be consumed or administered, or the type of medication treatment.
extension:code 0..1ExtensionCode for relevant Medication
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptCode for relevant Medication
Binding: SNOMEDCTMedicationCodes (example): A coded concept identifying substance or product that can be ordered.
extension:precondition 0..*ExtensionObservation that suggets this condition
Slices for extension 2..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Closed by value:url
extension:type 1..1Extensionsensitive | specific
value[x] 0..1codesensitive | specific
Binding: Cross-version VS for R5.ConditionPreconditionType for use in FHIR R4 (required): Kind of precondition for the condition.
extension:code 1..1ExtensionCode for relevant Observation
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptCode for relevant Observation
Binding: LOINCCodes (example): Codes identifying names of simple observations.
extension:value[x] 0..1ExtensionValue of Observation
value[x] 0..1Value of Observation
valueCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
valueQuantityQuantity
extension:team 0..*ExtensionAppropriate team for this condition
value[x] 0..1Reference(CareTeam)Appropriate team for this condition
extension:questionnaire 0..*ExtensionQuestionnaire for this condition
Slices for extension 2..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Closed by value:url
extension:purpose 1..1Extensionpreadmit | diff-diagnosis | outcome
value[x] 0..1codepreadmit | diff-diagnosis | outcome
Binding: Cross-version VS for R5.ConditionQuestionnairePurpose for use in FHIR R4 (required): The use of a questionnaire.
extension:reference 1..1ExtensionSpecific Questionnaire
value[x] 0..1Reference(Questionnaire)Specific Questionnaire
extension:plan 0..*ExtensionPlan that is appropriate
Slices for extension 1..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Closed by value:url
extension:role 0..1ExtensionUse for the plan
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptUse for the plan
extension:reference 1..1ExtensionThe actual plan
value[x] 0..1Reference(PlanDefinition)The actual plan
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-ConditionDefinition"

Documentation for this format

name: ext_R5_ConditionDefinition
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.ConditionDefinition for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents ConditionDefinition from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ConditionDefinition|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.definition: A definition of a condition and information relevant to managing it.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Canonical identifier for this condition definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this condition definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the condition definition is stored on different servers.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the condition definition is stored on different servers.

element.short: Business version of the condition definition
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the condition definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

element.short: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate condition definition instances.

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).

element.definition: A definition of a condition and information relevant to managing it.

element.short: Canonical identifier for this condition definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this condition definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the condition definition is stored on different servers.

element.short: Canonical identifier for this condition definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this condition definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the condition definition is stored on different servers.

element.short: Business version of the condition definition
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the condition definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

element.short: Business version of the condition definition
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the condition definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.
Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

element.short: Name for this condition definition (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the condition definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

element.short: Name for this condition definition (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the condition definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

element.short: Name for this condition definition (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the condition definition.

element.short: Name for this condition definition (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the condition definition.

element.short: Subordinate title of the event definition
element.definition: An explanatory or alternate title for the event definition giving additional information about its content.

element.short: Subordinate title of the event definition
element.definition: An explanatory or alternate title for the event definition giving additional information about its content.
The status of this condition definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.isModifierReason: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not use a retired {{title}} without due consideration

element.definition: The status of this condition definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this condition definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

element.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this condition definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

The date  (and optionally time) when the condition definition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the condition definition changes.

The date  (and optionally time) when the condition definition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the condition definition changes.

element.short: Name of the publisher/steward (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the condition definition.

element.short: Name of the publisher/steward (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the condition definition.
Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

element.short: Natural language description of the condition definition
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the condition definition from a consumer's perspective.

element.short: Natural language description of the condition definition
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the condition definition from a consumer's perspective.

element.short: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate condition definition instances.

element.short: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate condition definition instances.

element.short: Intended jurisdiction for condition definition (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the condition definition is intended to be used.

element.short: Intended jurisdiction for condition definition (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the condition definition is intended to be used.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.definition: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.
A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

binding.description: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

element.definition: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.
The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

binding.description: SNOMED CT Body site concepts

element.definition: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.
Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

binding.description: Codes describing condition stages (e.g. Cancer stages).

element.definition: Whether Severity is appropriate to collect for this condition.
Whether Severity is appropriate to collect for this condition.
Whether bodySite is appropriate to collect for this condition.
Whether bodySite is appropriate to collect for this condition.
Whether stage is appropriate to collect for this condition.
Whether stage is appropriate to collect for this condition.
Formal definitions of the condition. These may be references to ontologies, published clinical protocols or research papers.
Formal definitions of the condition. These may be references to ontologies, published clinical protocols or research papers.

element.short: Observations particularly relevant to this condition

binding.description: Codes for high level observation categories.
Codes identifying names of simple observations.

element.short: Medications particularly relevant for this condition

binding.description: A coded concept identifying the category of medication request.  For example, where the medication is to be consumed or administered, or the type of medication treatment.
A coded concept identifying substance or product that can be ordered.

element.definition: An observation that suggests that this condition applies.
Kind of pre-condition.
Kind of pre-condition.

binding.description: Kind of precondition for the condition.
Codes identifying names of simple observations.

element.definition: Use of the questionnaire.
Use of the questionnaire.

binding.description: The use of a questionnaire.
